intro: Callicarpa formosana var. tzitanshaniana, commonly known as the Tzitanshan beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It is characterized by its clusters of small, violet-blue berries that appear in late summer. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and a fragrant, aromatic scent. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. Its ornamental value is due to its vibrant berries and attractive foliage.
